TopicTitle: Designflaws of the new forum on smartphones

Articles.Content:
I tried to use the new forum on my smartphone, but i have several issues that make it very hard to use. I want to bring your attention to them so they can be fixed.
Im using the forum on my 2013 HTC One m7 with Firefox. It has a 1920*1080 screen, which is currently mainstream for smartphones, so i assume i talk for many. I have to options to display the forum, with the mobile version (as it is default on smartphones) or by enforcing the desktopversion, which i can only do with my browser and has to be refreshed everytime i closed it.

Here i post the same forum area, mobile version left, desktop version right. I edited them to mark stuff ill write about beneath them.

As you can see the mobile Version has a realy big issue, it displays almost nothing. I can see the names of 4 subforums (and their postcount), and when somebody (we only get a profilepicture) replied to ANYTHING in there the last time.
The desktopversion shows 7 subforums, which is ok, but almost half the width gets covered by the last devblogs. Make that smaller, maybe you will fit 2 additional subforums on the screen..

 

Again, the mobile forum manages to fit 4,5 threads on 1920 pixels height, as you can see with the desktop version much more is possible. Also only the profile picture of the last reply, not the name. While the desktop version shows much more it still wastes lots of area for literaly nothing, i marked it red.

 

Here we have some posts in one of the Threads. The mobile version cant even display 2 posts with almost no text on one page (remember, 1920 pixel!). Most of the page is filled with withe areas, i marked them red in case you missed them :D.
The dekstop version shows way more stuff, almost 6 posts, which limnits the scrolling to something reasonable.

 

As i have shown the mobile version is almost unusable, my finger still hurts from scrolling to those posts in the 1.0.5 discussion and it lacks information. The desktopversion has its flaws, too, but is usable. We just need something to set it as our default (why cant i delete the line between "de-fault"?) and to delte those unused spaces.

Excellent post. Describes exactly what i feel on mobile ! I have the same issue : i also have a phone with a huge screen (one plus one) and yet i can only see 2posts max at a time, with only 1line per post.

It's worse when writing a post because the text is displayed even bigger and two white spaces appear on the sides. Add to that the extra space taken by the virtual keyboard... And you can read a few lines at a time maxi.

 

-except i can't access desktop version from my mobile... My browser is Android chrome but i can't get the desktop version whatever i try to do. How did you do it ?

 

I must also report that the text editor is unbearable on mobile : spaces magically disappear and letters auto-duplicate. Also, quickly pressing "delete" 2 or 3 times will very often delete letters from the previous word instead of the letters directly behind it. Did that happen to you too ?
Im using Firefox, it has a simple checkbox to activate desktop mode.
